bioghist.p: George Aaron Barton (1859-1942) graduated from Haverford in 1882. He received a master's degree from Haverford in 1885 and a Ph.D. from Harvard in 1891. Barton was Professor of Biblical Literature and Semitic Languages at Bryn Mawr College until 1922, when he joined the faculty of the University of Pennsylvania. He was the Director of the American School for Oriental Research at Jerusalem (1902-1903) and at Baghdad (1921-1934). Barton was a deacon and priest in the Episcopal church.

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of the personal papers of George Aaron Barton. Materials include correspondence, newspaper clippings and personal memorabilia. The correspondence includes letters written during Barton's trip to Palestine in 1903, letters to learned societies, letters to Mrs. Barton regarding her husband's publications and his library, and letters commemorating Barton's accomplishments. The collection also includes a typed and annotated manuscript of Barton's 1916 publication Archaeology and the Bible.
